c74object.name: abc.scopeembedded
c74object.digest: Abclib's Visualization of X-Y signals using Jitter
c74object.description:
abc.scopeembedded is an abstraction to be used within a bpatcher in association with abc.hoa.scope~ object to visualize X-Y signals for instance ambisonic components at the order N. There are 3 signal inputs: X signal, Y signal and a binary signal (1/0) to tell the drawing corresponds to positive (red) values or negative (blue) ones.
Two parameters can be set by message in the right inlet: the type of drawing, the size of the drawing. The two default values can be set thanks to the bpatcher inspector. A unique 4 digit number is attributed to each instance and each visualization window.

attribute.name: drawing-type
attribute.description: [ONLY IN INSPECTOR] type of drawing (points or lines).

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: [ONLY IN INSPECTOR] size of the drawing.

method.name: drawing-type
method.description: [ONLY IN INSPECTOR] type of drawing (points or lines)

method.name: size
method.description: [ONLY IN INSPECTOR] size of the drawing.
